alert.note: Alert for Churchill; Douglas; Lyon; Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 31 at 3:51PM PDT until May 31 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western Churchill County in west central Nevada... Northwestern Mineral County in western Nevada... Douglas County in western Nevada... Central Lyon County in west central Nevada... * Until 445 PM PDT. * At 347 PM PDT, a dust plume was near Stillwater, or 10 miles east of Fallon, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Gusty winds over Lahontan Reservoir could capsize small watercraft and create hazardous lake conditions. US-50 from Sand Mountain to Silver Springs. US-95 from Trinity Junction to Schurz. Alt-US-50 from Hazen to Fernley. I-80 from Trinity Junction to Fernley. Locations impacted include... Fallon, Lahontan Reservoir, Fernley, Wabuska, Hazen, Stillwater, Silver Springs, Trinity Junction, Fort Churchill Station, Schurz, Fallon Municipal Airport, Desert Peak, Fallon Station, and Lone Rock. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust can be hazardous. Delay or reroute travel. Remain aware of the weather. If on Lahontan Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle.
